alert.note: Alert for Broward; Miami-Dade; Palm Beach (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 28 at 4:19PM EDT until September 29 at 1:00AM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of South Florida, including the following counties, Broward, Miami-Dade and Palm Beach. * WHEN...Until 600 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 417 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated a feeder band moving east northeast through the metro areas of Broward, Miami-Dade and Southern Palm Beach Counties with rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches on top of the already 6 and 10 inches of rain have fallen over these areas from previous feeder bands. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Miami, Hialeah, Fort Lauderdale, Pembroke Pines, Hollywood, Miramar, Coral Springs, Pompano Beach, Davie, Miami Beach, Plantation, Sunrise, Boca Raton, Deerfield Beach, Boynton Beach, Delray Beach, Tamarac, Margate, Coral Gables and Key Biscayne. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
